sub_title: Product Owner Certified | Digital Marketing Specialist | Scrum Master certified | Enterprise SaaS Marketing | D&I and anti-racism advocate
summary:
Dynamic and entrepreneurial B2B marketing expert who understands international business and translates strategic visions into deliverable outcomes and accelerates revenue and customer penetration worldwide. Experience in go-to-market planning/execution in complex Data & Analytics B2B businesses and launching innovative products into global markets.

Marketing owner of a 5-person agile squad focused on customer retention marketing for our University Research Administrator & Leader audience. We have launched and manage two new customer engagement programs and publish a monthly newsletter providing unfiltered perspectives on global issues by research and academic leaders.

A certified Scrum Master supporting our team to quickly deliver incremental value to customers at Academic and Government institutions.  

Passionate advocate for organisations to evolve and develop new strategies to propel global brands forward and pulls on data and analytics to obtain insights. Part of a team that focuses on customer retention efforts for all global markets, evaluates and improves customer journeys in SaaS environment, shapes insightful value propositions and forges partnerships, focused on marketing-generated revenue via digital & event channels. 

Continuously educating myself and others on the importance of Diversity & Inclusion, Unconscious Bias and how to actively be anti-racist, particularly concerning its impact within the workforce.

Graduate of the RELX ‘Developing Talent for Gender Equity’ program designed to proactively increase gender balance in senior leadership positions at RELX, the RELX Emerging Leaders program and the Elevate Coaching program

Skills & expertise:
• Go-to-market planning • Digital and business transformation • Customer-driven value proposition • Digital & social media advertising •  Stakeholder Management • Program Management and Measurement • New product development & launches • Data Analytics • Strategic Partnership Building  • User Engagement & new Hire Training Programs  • Leadership  • Digital Advertising • Inclusion & Diversity advocate •

If you have any opportunities or would like to connect, please feel free to reach out.

projects.title: Green & Sustainable Chemistry Challenge
projects.description:
The Elsevier Green and Sustainable Chemistry Challenge is open to individuals or organisations operating in the not-for-profit and for-profit sectors from all countries. Projects can be in any field of Green or Sustainable Chemistry so long as they are applicable for use in developing countries. 

In its first year the challenge attracted close to 500 entries, which were presented to panel of reviewers and finally to the board of judges who selected the Top 5 submissions. The winner and runner up were selected at the Green & Sustainable Chemistry Conference, Berlin in June 2016.

In its second year the challenge attracted 685 submissions.

profile_positions.description: Taken on a Marketing Owner role of a 5-person squad focused on customer retention marketing for our University Research Administrator & Leader audience. We have launched and manage two new customer engagement programs building them from the ground-up, including two product certification courses as well as a customer advisory community. Launching a newsletter providing unfiltered perspectives on global issues by research and academic leaders reaching 30,000 globally dispersed academic leaders.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Owner | Senior Digital Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description:
Certified Scrum Master focused on the Research Leaders & Funders retention marketing, supporting and educating the team in Agile best practices, ensuring delivery of incremental and impactful products to improve our customers’ experience with our suite of SaaS solutions.

Digital marketing specialist focusing on improving the customer experience through executing and optimizing digital campaigns including in-product guidance, onboarding support and social media communication and education. 

Building and rolling out the SciVal Certification Program to educate 1,000+ customers in getting the most form their subscription.
profile_positions.title: Senior Digital Marketing Manager | Certified Scrum Master

profile_positions.description: Strategic partner to Product Management Team, working closely with them to communicate the the product value to various audiences including the Research Office, librarians and researchers. Creating and communicating the evolving, unique value narrative which addresses pressing, global research challenges.
profile_positions.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager (Scopus)

profile_positions.description:
Working closely with the product, UX and market research team to communicate the value of a new research ecosystem. Communicating the value proposition internally and externally, and collaborating with development partners to ensure they are aware of the extra value created by combined and integrating existing research solution into one platform.

Ensuring the future vision is maintained whilst explaining the current functionalities, and short term roadmap.
profile_positions.title: Platform Marketing Lead (Short Term Project)

profile_positions.description: Responsible for developing the marketing strategy for SciVal, an enterprise SaaS solutions and big data analytical services aimed at improving the research strategies of universities, governments and funding bodies. Building the customer value story and optimizing the customer experience with product.
profile_positions.title: Product Marketing Manager (SciVal)

profile_positions.description: Designed, launched and executed Elsevier's first chemistry challenge in collaboration with publishing partners. Resulted in 500+ submission in its inaugural year (500% higher than anticipated).
profile_positions.title: Marketing Communications Manager

profile_positions.description: An online B2B marketplace for the supply and sponsorship of 100% compostable coffee cups, hosted by local cafes & events. Bringing new, innovative and sustainable branding solutions to cafes, businesses (big and small) to help them tell their brand story to consumers.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description: Developed and implemented a marketing communications plan, based upon business objectives identified and defined by President, Vice-President and extended committee. Increased membership of the Danish Club Dannebrog by 15% annually. Organised and created media exposure for several Danish community events inc. HRH Prince Frederik and Prince Mary visiting Denmark House, Taste of Denmark and our annual inclusion in Melbourne Food & Wine Festival.
profile_positions.title: Marketing & Media Manager

volunteer_experiences.description: Serving as a mentor to help the next generation uncover their purpose & empower them to define their own career path

Rising TIDE paid internships enable college students and recent grads from diverse backgrounds to work in product development, publishing, marketing, finance and tech.

https://www.elsevier.com/connect/elsevier-internship-develops-diverse-talent-across-race-ethnicity-and-disability

I work with the other my fellow members to set up and run educational events and discussion groups on a variety of topics to help eliminate systemic racism in research and health. 

Embrace is an Employee Resource Group supported by Elsevier's CEO, Kumsal Bayazit, and is focusing on three areas:

1. Ensure a culture and practice of inclusion and diversity at Elsevier.
2. Eliminate systemic racism in research and health.
3. Support anti-racist organisations with Elsevier's influence and resources.

Embrace stands against systemic racism; for humanity, for empathy and pride to be an ethnic minority in the workplace. Embrace believes in an intersectional approach to address inequalities. We believe it is fundamental to embrace our vulnerabilities, connect with others, and foster a culture of allyship – all of this will empower us at Elsevier and our wider communities.

volunteer_experiences.role: Head of Marketing & Social Media Specialist

volunteer_experiences.description: Involved in coordinating and communicating with members, club president and university staff prior to, during and following all major events. Brain-storming for unique fundraising ideas and how best to attract new members. Promoting upcoming meetings to club mentors, committee and club   members through various media channels including emails, the ECSS webpage and university publications. General administrative duties including developing up-to-date member registry. Projecting cost of various events to be held throughout the year, ensuring enough funds were raised throughout the year to cover the expenses of the society.

Assisted in building a database of new members (donors) and cross-referencing with existing members (donors) through the use of Donman. Updating details of existing donors in order to send out promotional material for upcoming events. Facilitated the wrapping, packing and posting of over 1000 presents on AMF’s behalf to underprivileged children throughout Australia.
Initially attended an intensive three-day volunteers training program. Supported students’ learning and skills development i.e. numeracy, literacy and reading skills.
